snippet: Iranian authorities were caught off guard over the weekend when thousands of people joined spontaneous gatherings around the country to mourn and remember a pop singer who died of cancer at age 30.
abstract: Iranian authorities are caught off guard after thousands of people join spontaneous gatherings around country to mourn pop singer Morteza Pashaei, who died of cancer at age 30; police attempt to disperse crowds that are among largest since mass protests over the disputed 2009 election.
lead_paragraph: Iranian authorities were caught off guard over the weekend when thousands of people joined spontaneous gatherings around the country to mourn and remember a pop singer who died of cancer at age 30.

headline.main: Public Grieving for Pop Singer Is Startling for Iran
headline.print_headline: Public Grieving for Pop Singer Is Startling for Iran
